reviews.review_msg: Did not actually teach us during lecture. All we did was homework that we would come into class to discuss in groups and call her when needed. Entire text book is in Spanish which was frustrating. Deffs not a beginners class but you won't fail if you barely know any Spanish. Quite vague about assignments. Assumed we all knew how to use certain term

This course is taken in order to learn or further expand your knowledge of Spanish, Rita does neither. Does not teach & expects you to self teach, gives an unreasonable amount of homework to introductory students, inconsistent with marks, offers to boost marks if you don't understand instead of teaching, instructions are not reliable, overall awful

She NEVER teaches in class. There are so much homework and preparation. I try my best to finish ALL of them but it takes me more than 4 hours per week because I have no knowledge in Spanish. I honestly do not like her 'teaching' style because all she does is put us in groups and learn by ourselves. This is too stressful.

Do not, under any circumstances, take a class with Rita! She does not teach and expects you to learn from the groups youre put into at the beginning of the term. Unfortunately, I had previous experience in Spanish (yes you read that right, unfortunately) because she doesnt like to explain grammar. Marks you wrong because she cant read your writing.

Very disorganized. Did not teach at all. She makes you do the online exercises which is very time consuming, so there's no point going to class. Puts you in groups and expects you to learn from each other. Focuses on non-important material. Does not know her own syllabus outline. Avoid this class with her. Take it with another prof!

Very inconsistent with instructions and grading. Did not "teach" at all, you were expected to show up to class having done the textbook work and then just talk with peers about it and do the oral group work. Doesn't make sense half the time, just learn her "rules" and obey them at all costs to get the marks
